metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3698 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The jabber_idn_validate function in jutil.c in the Jabber protocol pluginin libpurple in Pidgin before 2.10.10 allows remote attackers to obtainsensitive information from process memory via a crafted XMPP message.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3698` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

finch - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
libpurple-bin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
libpurple0 - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
pidgin - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
pidgin-data - 1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pidgin package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.10.9-0ubuntu3.2').
